str2: Neuter of hostis as conjunction; demonstrative, that; causative, because.

parse: Personal / Possessive Pronoun - Genitive Masculine 3rd Person Singular
str2: He, she, it, they, them, same. From the particle au; the reflexive pronoun self, used of the third person, and of the other persons.
Decision; by extension, a tribunal; by implication, justice.
True (lit: made of truth), real, genuine. From alethes; truthful.
And, even, also, namely.
From dike; equitable; by implication, innocent, holy.

parse: Verb - Aorist Indicative Active - 3rd Person Singular
str2: Properly, to distinguish, i.e. Decide; by implication, to try, condemn, punish.
The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.
Large, great, in the widest sense.
A prostitute; met: an idolatrous community. Feminine of pornos; a strumpet; figuratively, an idolater.

parse: Personal / Relative Pronoun - Nominative Feminine Singular
str2: Whosoever, whichsoever, whatsoever.

parse: Verb - Imperfect Indicative Active - 3rd Person Singular
str2: To corrupt, spoil, destroy, ruin. Probably strengthened from phthio; properly, to shrivel or wither, i.e. To spoil or to ruin.
The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.
Contracted from a primary word; soil; by extension a region, or the solid part or the whole of the terrene globe.
In, on, among. A primary preposition denoting position, and instrumentality, i.e. A relation of rest; 'in, ' at, on, by, etc.

parse: Personal / Possessive Pronoun - Genitive Feminine 3rd Person Singular
str2: He, she, it, they, them, same. From the particle au; the reflexive pronoun self, used of the third person, and of the other persons.
Fornication, whoredom; met: idolatry. From porneuo; harlotry; figuratively, idolatry.

parse: Verb - Aorist Indicative Active - 3rd Person Singular
str2: To give justice over, defend, avenge, vindicate. From ekdikos; to vindicate, retaliate, punish.
The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.
Blood, literally, figuratively or specially; by implication, bloodshed, also kindred.

parse: Personal / Possessive Pronoun - Genitive Masculine 3rd Person Singular
str2: He, she, it, they, them, same. From the particle au; the reflexive pronoun self, used of the third person, and of the other persons.
(a) (as adj.) enslaved, (b) (as noun) a (male) slave. From deo; a slave.
From out, out from among, from, suggesting from the interior outwards. A primary preposition denoting origin, from, out.

A hand.
